perturbation.original_text:
"Allscripts Customer" means a customer that has contracted for or receiving any of Allscripts' products or services.

"Allscripts Practice Management" means the practice management system currently marketed and sold by Allscripts as "Allscripts Practice Management" (as the same may be renamed, enhanced or expanded from time to time)
perturbation.changed_text:
"Allscripts Customer" means a customer that has contracted for or receiving any of Allscripts' products or services. This definition only applies to customers actively paying for Allscripts products or services. Customers in a trial period, or those using a freemium version of a product, may or may not be considered Allscripts Customers at Allscripts' sole discretion.

"Allscripts Practice Management" means the practice management system currently marketed and sold by Allscripts as "Allscripts Practice Management" (as the same may be renamed, enhanced or expanded from time to time)
perturbation.explanation: The modification to the "Allscripts Customer" definition introduces ambiguity by stating that customers in a trial period or those using a freemium version of a product 'may or may not be considered Allscripts Customers at Allscripts's sole discretion.' This contradicts the initial definition, which clearly states that an Allscripts Customer is one 'that has contracted for or receiving any of Allscripts' products or services,' regardless of payment status. The ambiguity creates uncertainty about which customers are entitled to certain rights and privileges under the agreement.

perturbation.changed_text:
8.  Licenses and Intellectual Property.

8.1 License Grant. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Company hereby grants to Allscripts and its Affiliates a non- exclusive, royalty-free, irrevocable [***] non-transferable (except in accordance with Section 28.4), sublicensable (through multiple levels of sublicensees), fully paid-up right and license under all of the Company's Intellectual Property to, throughout the Territory, access, use, reproduce, perform, display, modify, create derivative works of, transmit, demonstrate, test, operate, port, configure, distribute, and make available the Installed Software and Subscription Software Services solely for the purposes of:

(a) Allscripts' and its Affiliates' internal use of the Installed Software and Subscription Software Services as permitted hereunder. However, the right to modify and create derivative works is strictly prohibited without express written consent from the Company, which may be withheld for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: While the original text grants Allscripts the right to 'modify' and 'create derivative works' of the Installed Software and Subscription Software Services for internal use, the modified text adds a contradictory statement that 'the right to modify and create derivative works is strictly prohibited without express written consent from the Company, which may be withheld for any reason.' This creates a direct conflict, as one clause allows for modification and derivative work creation, while the other prohibits it without consent. This uncertainty undermines the scope of the license granted to Allscripts and could lead to disputes over their ability to customize or adapt the software for their internal needs.

perturbation.original_text:
12. Support and Maintenance.

12.1 Support Services.

(a) The Company is solely responsible for the development, update, performance, and maintenance of the Subscription Software Service. The Company covenants to use its best efforts to ensure that the Subscription Software Services are made available to Allscripts and each Sublicensed Customer and that support for Merchant Processing Services are made available to each Sublicensed Customer in accordance with the warranties, terms, and conditions of this Agreement and in accordance with any performance standards specified in this Agreement or in the Documentation. [***]
perturbation.changed_text:
12. Support and Maintenance.

12.1 Support Services.

(a) The Company is solely responsible for the development, update, performance, and maintenance of the Subscription Software Service. While the Company will endeavor to provide consistent service, Allscripts acknowledges and agrees that the Company may, at its sole discretion and without prior notice, temporarily suspend or discontinue any aspect of the Subscription Software Services due to technical issues, maintenance requirements, or unforeseen circumstances. The Company covenants to use its best efforts to ensure that the Subscription Software Services are made available to Allscripts and each Sublicensed Customer and that support for Merchant Processing Services are made available to each Sublicensed Customer in accordance with the warranties, terms, and conditions of this Agreement and in accordance with any performance standards specified in this Agreement or in the Documentation. [***]
perturbation.explanation: Section 12.1(a) states that 'The Company is solely responsible for the development, update, performance, and maintenance of the Subscription Software Service' and 'covenants to use its best efforts to ensure that the Subscription Software Services are made available to Allscripts and each Sublicensed Customer'. The modified version introduces a direct contradiction by stating, 'Allscripts acknowledges and agrees that the Company may, at its sole discretion and without prior notice, temporarily suspend or discontinue any aspect of the Subscription Software Services due to technical issues, maintenance requirements, or unforeseen circumstances.' This creates uncertainty as to the Company's actual obligations regarding the availability of the services and undermines the initial promise of best efforts to ensure availability.
